Description: Stamped handle of pottery transport amphora, probably Cnidian; stamp with triangular Greek monogram containing several letters.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Old Speech Room Gallery and Museum, Harrow School. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Budge suggests that the Greek monogram may make up the name of Aristagoras. Budge, E.A.W. 1887, Catalogue of the Egyptian antiquities from the collection of the late Sir Gardner Wilkinson, Harrow School Museum, Harrow, 85.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0267)
